Speaker: nikolai
Dialogue: I thought I'd bring it back before it got stolen. Lot of villains around. Sorry about the chain.

Speaker: anna
Dialogue: You read the diary?

Speaker: nikolai
Dialogue: I told you.    I'm just a driver.

Speaker: anna
Dialogue: You look the other way.

Speaker: nikolai
Dialogue: I'm a camera. The pictures stay in my head.

Speaker: anna
Dialogue: Why did you bring me this?

Speaker: nikolai
Dialogue: I don't know. I was passing.

Speaker: anna
Dialogue: I don't know.

Speaker: nikolai
Dialogue: Well, he's a brave old man.    That's for sure.

Speaker: ekrem
Dialogue: Hey! Hey Kabuka Chelsea! Fuck you!! Yeah you! Aliverisme!! Fucker!

Speaker: chechen
Dialogue: For my brother...

Speaker: dishwasher
Dialogue: Guy out the back.

Speaker: semyon
Dialogue: So what did they say?

Speaker: ozim
Dialogue: They were going to kill me.   Those Chechens are savages.

Speaker: semyon
Dialogue: What did they say about my son?

Speaker: ozim
Dialogue: They said they would spare me only if I delivered Kirill to them.

Speaker: semyon
Dialogue: You are being very honest.

Speaker: ozim
Dialogue: I fear you more than I fear them.

Speaker: semyon
Dialogue: Never again do business with any member of my family behind my back.

Speaker: ozim
Dialogue: Never. I will never listen to Kirill again. I swear...

Speaker: semyon
Dialogue: Do they know where to find Kirill?

Speaker: ozim
Dialogue: They are like wolves.

Speaker: semyon
Dialogue: Do they know what he looks like?

Speaker: ozim
Dialogue: No. They have just arrived from the mountains.

Speaker: semyon
Dialogue: Then tell them you will deliver Kirill to them.

Speaker: anna
Dialogue: Mum... I can't get hold of Stepan.

Speaker: helen
Dialogue: Why do you want to?

Speaker: anna
Dialogue: I need to check something with him.

Speaker: helen
Dialogue: Anna...

Speaker: anna
Dialogue: He's not at home, do you know where else he might be?

Speaker: helen
Dialogue: Anna. Haven't you had enough excitement?

Speaker: anna
Dialogue: I think I've worked out who Christine's father is.

Speaker: helen
Dialogue: Why does it matter?!!

Speaker: anna
Dialogue: It matters... to me!!

Speaker: helen
Dialogue: You enjoy this.

Speaker: nikolai
Dialogue: What are you doing here?

Speaker: anna
Dialogue: I don't know. I was passing.

Speaker: kirill
Dialogue: If you're passing, you pass. You keep going, bitch. Nikolai, come on...

Speaker: anna
Dialogue: Family is important to you people isn't it?

Speaker: kirill
Dialogue: What the hell is she talking about?

Speaker: anna
Dialogue: Tell Semyon the baby I delivered on Christmas Eve is his daughter.

Speaker: kirill
Dialogue: What did she say?!

Speaker: anna
Dialogue: When he raped her she was a virgin. Then they gave her pills. Semyon has to be the father!

Speaker: nikolai
Dialogue: She's a civilian!

Speaker: anna
Dialogue: She was fourteen!      She was a child!

Speaker: kirill
Dialogue: You don't use my father's name! You don't say that filth about him...

Speaker: anna
Dialogue: Tell him what I said.

Speaker: nikolai
Dialogue: There is nothing to tell.      Slaves give birth to slaves...

Speaker: kirill
Dialogue: Come on Nikolai!!

Speaker: kirill
Dialogue: That girl you fucked in front of me... you remember her? The Ukrainian bitch?

Speaker: nikolai
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: kirill
Dialogue: So they kick down the door. These are ordinary fucking police. They ask for her by name and they take her away. Some fucking punter must have given them her name. What gives the police the right to take our women, huh?

Speaker: semyon
Dialogue: She is one hundred years old.

Speaker: kirill
Dialogue: Come on, Nikolai, help me.

Speaker: semyon
Dialogue: No. He stays here.   I want to talk business.

Speaker: kirill
Dialogue: What business?

Speaker: semyon
Dialogue: Go to the cellar Kirill.   And take your time.

Speaker: nikolai
Dialogue: Thank you. Papa.

Speaker: semyon
Dialogue: Tell him I changed my mind about the brandy.

Speaker: kirill
Dialogue: My dad swapped a little Georgian girl for this stuff.

Speaker: nikolai
Dialogue: He offered me stars. I accepted them.

Speaker: kirill
Dialogue: You think I didn't know already? He told me before. It was my fucking idea. He said there are a lot of things I have to teach you.

Speaker: nikolai
Dialogue: Yeah.

Speaker: kirill
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: nikolai
Dialogue: I know, Kirill.

Speaker: kirill
Dialogue: Where the fuck are you going? We've got to celebrate. Help me with these bottles.

Speaker: nikolai
Dialogue: Your dad don't need the bottles any more.

Speaker: kirill
Dialogue: Hey! We're still partners, right? Thunder and lightning!

Speaker: valery
Dialogue: We can see that you were in prison in Siberia. And that you were a thief.

Speaker: nikolai
Dialogue: My father was a government worker. He fixed the cars of officials. I began by selling the spare parts when I was fifteen.

Speaker: valery
Dialogue: You have no forced tattoos?

Speaker: nikolai
Dialogue: None.

Speaker: gypsy
Dialogue: You were not co-operative?

Speaker: nikolai
Dialogue: I spent two years in the punishment block.

Speaker: valery
Dialogue: You went through the Crosses in St. Petersburg?

Speaker: nikolai
Dialogue: I was in solitary confinement fifteen times. I was called 'The Stump' because they couldn't shift me.

Speaker: valery
Dialogue: Your father was a bitch and a weak fucker for working with the Government, that's right isn't it?

Speaker: nikolai
Dialogue: That's right. My father means nothing to me. My Mother....

Speaker: gypsy
Dialogue: You have no mother.      She was a whore anyway.

Speaker: nikolai
Dialogue: Yes. I have no mother and no father. There is only the code, the vory v zakone code which I have always followed.

Speaker: valery
Dialogue: That is why there is an empty place above your heart. Where the stars will go. And why there is an empty place on your knees.

Speaker: nikolai
Dialogue: I am dead already. I died when I was fifteen. Now I live in the zone all the time.

Speaker: gypsy
Dialogue: You have never worked for the government? Any government?

Speaker: nikolai
Dialogue: I have lived off Albanians and Georgians. I steal from them within the law.

Speaker: helen
Dialogue: Have you slept at all?

Speaker: anna
Dialogue: I don't think the driver would do anything to Stepan.

Speaker: helen
Dialogue: How do you know what he would do?

Speaker: ozim
Dialogue: Semyon recommends these places for business meetings because you can see what tattoos a man has.

Speaker: ozim
Dialogue: Our lines to Kabul get broken every two or three weeks.

Speaker: nikolai
Dialogue: How come?

Speaker: ozim
Dialogue: The Americans. Fucking NATO.  Valery Nabokov imports flowers and television sets into this country. The television sets are one in ten. That means one in ten have cargo inside them.

Speaker: nikolai
Dialogue: Where do they dock?

Speaker: ozim
Dialogue: I will tell you when I return from the bathroom.

Speaker: ozim
Dialogue: Kirill is in there.

Speaker: nikolai
Dialogue: Ozim?

Speaker: anna
Dialogue: I'm so late. Sorry.

Speaker: aziz
Dialogue: It's fine, although I think I've had enough.

Speaker: anna
Dialogue: Paul, on my way here I made a decision.

Speaker: aziz
Dialogue: You can't possibly dump me. We're not even going out.

Speaker: anna
Dialogue: Take my hand.

Speaker: aziz
Dialogue: Yes, I can.

Speaker: nurse
Dialogue: Anna?

Speaker: anna
Dialogue: Is it OK to talk to him for a minute?

Speaker: nurse
Dialogue: He's still in trauma.   Do you know him?

Speaker: anna
Dialogue: Yes.

Speaker: nikolai
Dialogue: I thought you did birth.

Speaker: anna
Dialogue: My uncle....

Speaker: nikolai
Dialogue: Yes.

Speaker: anna
Dialogue: Edinburgh?

Speaker: nikolai
Dialogue: I'm going to need some clothes. I arrived here without any. Can you get me some?

Speaker: anna
Dialogue: You can't walk out of here because you're attached to a drip. Explain Edinburgh.

Speaker: nikolai
Dialogue: Your uncle knew too much.

Speaker: anna
Dialogue: ...no, I couldn't get much sense out of him, he was drunk.

Speaker: nikolai
Dialogue: You got my message?

Speaker: yuri
Dialogue: Using a dead body to file a progress report must be against FSB regulations.

Speaker: nikolai
Dialogue: It's called improvisation.

Speaker: yuri
Dialogue: You've been improvising quite a lot lately. And taking risks.

Speaker: nikolai
Dialogue: You didn't come here to give me flowers...

Speaker: yuri
Dialogue: In light of what has happened to you...

Speaker: nikolai
Dialogue: Ah, Christ...

Speaker: yuri
Dialogue: ...and in light of other violent incidents associated with you, the Russian desk at Scotland Yard have made an official request to the Russian embassy that your undercover operation in London be terminated.

Speaker: nikolai
Dialogue: If they terminate the operation now, they will be wasting this...

Speaker: yuri
Dialogue: They are bound to ask... who did you kill?

Speaker: nikolai
Dialogue: Tell them I only killed myself.

Speaker: yuri
Dialogue: What drugs are they giving you? Maybe it's the anesthetic speaking.

Speaker: nikolai
Dialogue: I need you to take Semyon out of the picture. I want you to arrest him.

Speaker: yuri
Dialogue: Arrest him for what?

Speaker: nikolai
Dialogue: Rape.

Speaker: yuri
Dialogue: And of course, she will testify...

Speaker: nikolai
Dialogue: She doesn't have to.   She's dead.

Speaker: yuri
Dialogue: You intrigue me.

Speaker: nikolai
Dialogue: How is Uncle Stepan?

Speaker: anna
Dialogue: They're from the morgue. They belonged to someone who died yesterday.

Speaker: nikolai
Dialogue: Hey... wait a minute...

Speaker: anna
Dialogue: Yeah.     It's OK.

Speaker: nikolai
Dialogue: Did you get in touch with Tatiana's family in Russia?

Speaker: anna
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: nikolai
Dialogue: Good.

Speaker: anna
Dialogue: She's staying here for good.

Speaker: nikolai
Dialogue: Yeah, and all the thanks I get is a pair of dead man's shoes.                                          * I listen to you.                                    *

Speaker: nikolai
Dialogue: * These things are just marks on the skin, you know?

Speaker: kirill
Dialogue: What are you looking at?

Speaker: maria
Dialogue: You.

Speaker: kirill
Dialogue: Nothing, baby.

Speaker: maria
Dialogue: It sounded like something.

Speaker: kirill
Dialogue: Someone I know got hurt and I blamed Grandpa.

Speaker: maria
Dialogue: Did you fight each other?    I heard banging.

Speaker: kirill
Dialogue: No. It's not a fight if one of you doesn't fight back.

Speaker: semyon
Dialogue: You'll have a drink, Yuri...

Speaker: yuri
Dialogue: I don't drink on duty.

Speaker: semyon
Dialogue: Sometimes I don't believe you are really Russian.

Speaker: yuri
Dialogue: I've told you, I am half Russian.

Speaker: semyon
Dialogue: Then have half a drink.

Speaker: yuri
Dialogue: We just need a blood sample.

Speaker: semyon
Dialogue: For what?

Speaker: yuri
Dialogue: We can take the sample right now voluntarily or I can get an order from the court. It's up to you.

Speaker: semyon
Dialogue: He sits there like a vampire.

Speaker: yuri
Dialogue: What, you are afraid of needles, Semyon?

Speaker: semyon
Dialogue: I am afraid of... conspiracies.

Speaker: yuri
Dialogue: I will return tomorrow with a court order.

Speaker: semyon
Dialogue: Wait.       I've done nothing wrong.

Speaker: kirill
Dialogue: What did they want with you, papa?

Speaker: semyon
Dialogue: To poison me.

Speaker: kirill
Dialogue: Why would they want your blood, papa?

Speaker: semyon
Dialogue: I don't know.

Speaker: kirill
Dialogue: Maybe it's about the baby.

Speaker: semyon
Dialogue: What baby?

Speaker: kirill
Dialogue: Some bitch was out there saying you were the father of a baby.

Speaker: semyon
Dialogue: What are you talking about?

Speaker: kirill
Dialogue: It was nothing. Just some bitch...

Speaker: semyon
Dialogue: Who?

Speaker: kirill
Dialogue: The woman from the hospital.   The midwife.

Speaker: anna
Dialogue: Sonya! Is someone bathing Christine?

Speaker: sonya
Dialogue: No.   She's in her cot.

Speaker: anna
Dialogue: Well she's not. She's not.

Speaker: kirill
Dialogue: Hey, you stupid fucker!!

Speaker: anna
Dialogue: What happened to the patient with the knife cuts? The Russian?

Speaker: nurse
Dialogue: We just discharged him.   A couple of minutes ago.

Speaker: anna
Dialogue: Where have they taken Christine?!

Speaker: nikolai
Dialogue: What are you talking about?!

Speaker: anna
Dialogue: Kirill. Kirill has taken Christine. I saw him here! I thought he was coming to see you, but he wasn't, was he?

Speaker: nikolai
Dialogue: You brought your bike?

Speaker: nikolai
Dialogue: I'll drive.

Speaker: anna
Dialogue: I'll drive.

Speaker: kirill
Dialogue: She's a little girl, Papa, a little sweet fucking girl...

Speaker: anna
Dialogue: Kirill, let me take the baby.

Speaker: kirill
Dialogue: You stay where you are.

Speaker: anna
Dialogue: She's cold, Kirill.

Speaker: nikolai
Dialogue: Kirill, a vor doesn't kill little babies.

Speaker: kirill
Dialogue: I swear I didn't know my dad was setting you up.

Speaker: nikolai
Dialogue: He's going away. When he's gone the family business will be yours.

Speaker: anna
Dialogue: Who are you really? Why have you helped us?

Speaker: nikolai
Dialogue: How can I become King if the King is still in place?

Speaker: kirill
Dialogue: You come on, Nikolai! We're missing the fucking party of the year out there!! Get here and drive!!  That's a fucking order!!

Speaker: nikolai
Dialogue: Maybe I can drive you somewhere?

Speaker: anna
Dialogue: There's someone I can call.   He'll come and fetch us.
